title: Luminous Depths
subtitle: An exploration of light, shadow, and the spaces between
description:
Luminous Depths brings together five contemporary artists whose work interrogates the boundaries between the visible and the unseen. Through painting, sculpture, and installation, these artists invite viewers to consider how light shapes our perception of space, memory, and emotion.

This exhibition marks the first time these artists have shown together, creating a dialogue that spans continents and artistic traditions. Each work responds to the gallery's unique architecture, transforming familiar spaces into realms of contemplation and wonder.

artists.name: Amara Osei
artists.bio: Amara Osei's large-scale paintings explore the interplay of natural and artificial light. Her work draws on West African textile traditions and contemporary color theory.

artists.name: Kenji Watanabe
artists.bio: Working primarily in steel and glass, Watanabe creates kinetic sculptures that fragment and redirect ambient light. His installations have been exhibited at museums across Asia and Europe.

artists.name: Sofia Reyes
artists.bio: Reyes combines photography and mixed media to investigate urban landscapes at twilight. Her work captures the liminal quality of cities transitioning between day and night.

artists.name: Lars Eriksson
artists.bio: Eriksson's minimalist installations use fiber optics and projection to create immersive environments that respond to viewer movement.

artists.name: Priya Sharma
artists.bio: Sharma's watercolors and ink drawings explore bioluminescence and the light produced by living organisms. Her scientific background informs her deeply detailed approach.

artworks.title: Golden Hour (Accra)
artworks.medium: Oil and gold leaf on canvas
artworks.description: A monumental painting capturing the warm light of late afternoon in Accra, layered with geometric patterns drawn from kente cloth.

artworks.title: Refraction Study VII
artworks.description: A slowly rotating sculpture that casts prismatic light patterns across the gallery walls, creating an ever-changing environment.

artworks.title: Dusk, Avenida Reforma
artworks.medium: Archival pigment print, acrylic, and neon
artworks.description: A layered photographic work depicting Mexico City's iconic boulevard at the moment streetlights first illuminate.

artworks.title: Threshold (Room for One)
artworks.description: An immersive room-scale installation where thousands of fiber optic threads respond to a single viewer's presence and movement.

artworks.title: Abyssal Light Series: Anglerfish
artworks.medium: Watercolor, ink, and phosphorescent pigment on paper
artworks.description: A quartet of works depicting deep-sea bioluminescent creatures, painted with phosphorescent pigments that glow in darkness.

artworks.title: Shadow Archive
artworks.medium: Charcoal and silver pigment on raw linen
artworks.description: A striking tonal work exploring the absence of light, where silver pigment catches and releases illumination as the viewer moves.

curator.name: Dr. Helena Marchetti
curator.bio: Dr. Marchetti is a curator and art historian specializing in contemporary practices around light and space. She previously served as Senior Curator at the Museo d'Arte Contemporanea in Turin.
